title: Astronauts Come Home Early from Space Due to Health Problem
summary: Four astronauts had to leave the International Space Station early because one of them got sick. They landed safely back on Earth in the ocean near California. The astronauts are Mike Fincke, Zena Cardman, Kimiya Yui, and Oleg Platonov. They were supposed to stay in space for six and a half months but came home a month early. NASA said the sick astronaut is stable and doing okay. This is the first time astronauts have been evacuated from the space station for health reasons since it started in 1998. The space station is a big lab in space where scientists study how living in space affects people and plants. Now, only three astronauts are left on the station until more arrive next month.

questions.question: Why did the astronauts leave the space station early?
options: Because they wanted to go home

What is the International Space Station?
When was the space station first put into orbit?
How many astronauts are left on the space station now?

background_read: The International Space Station is a home in space where astronauts from different countries live and do experiments. It orbits Earth very fast, about 16 times a day. Astronauts train to handle small health problems, but if someone gets seriously sick, they might need to come back to Earth for help. This article talks about a rare event where astronauts had to leave early because of a medical issue.
Article_Structure: WHO: Four astronauts: Mike Fincke, Zena Cardman, Kimiya Yui, and Oleg Platonov
WHAT: They evacuated from the International Space Station early due to a medical issue and landed safely on Earth
WHERE: They landed in the ocean off the coast of California, and the space station orbits Earth at 250 miles high
WHY: Because one crew member had a serious health problem, so they needed to return for medical care

perspectives.description: The evacuation shows that astronaut health is the top priority, even if it means cutting a mission short.
